info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 22 at 3:24PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN ROOSEVELT AND NORTHEASTERN CHAVES COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM MDT... At 324 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Kenna, or 33 miles southwest of Portales, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Kenna. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.
